action.action-desc: Mr. Clay (for himself and Mr. Stivers) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services
Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To increase from $10,000,000,000 to $50,000,000,000 the threshold figure at which regulated depository institutions are subject to direct examination and reporting requirements of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection Examination and Reporting Threshold Act of 2017.
Section 1025(a) of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5515(a)) is amended by striking $10,000,000,000 each place that term appears and inserting $50,000,000,000.
Section 1026(a) of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5516(a)) is amended by striking $10,000,000,000 each place that term appears and inserting $50,000,000,000.
This Act and the amendments made by this Act shall take effect on the date that is 45 days after the date of enactment of this Act.
